sub_title: Deputy manager Flexpool of the municipality of Almere
summary: I am enthusiastic and ambitious and I have a strong record and significant experience in the delivery and implementation of complex projects, including international projects. . I like motivating people and helping them to discover and develop their talents and skills. I provide consistency and stability in complex environments. I am able to maintain my focus on goals and objectives with losing sight of the necessary details. I have a pragmatic and positive work ethic and approach and am skilled at driving projects forward, making sure things get done and the desired outcomes are achieved.

treasury_media.title: Boekuitgave: Het geheim van de 10 E’s, Action Learning in organisaties
treasury_media.description: Graag maken wij jullie deelgenoot van  de uitgave van het boek “Het geheim van de 10 E’s, Action Learning in organisaties”. Met een mooie praktijkcase van de gemeente Almere.

treasury_media.title: Leren van elkaar, informeel leren en het 70:20:10 model
treasury_media.description: De top 3 leertrends in organisaties is in oplopende volgorde: 1. meer interne kennisdeling, 2. meer begeleiding/coaching door collega’s en 3. meer eigen initiatief van werknemers. Dat klinkt mooi, maar hoe bereik je dit in de praktijk? Een mooi praktijkvoorbeeld bij de Gemeente Almere.

courses.name: Het goede gesprek over..., Het Wil Consult
Leergang sturen op stroom, Publiek Domein

profile_positions.description: The upcoming years my focus will be on the further professionalisation of the Flex Pool. At the same time I’m running different projects and programmes. Our professionals, who work in the field of programme management, project management and interim management, manage complex and multidisciplinary issues. This requires for our department, to be flexible and to be open to continuously learn and improve ourselves. We are committed to be recognised as the expert in the fields mentioned above and as an important sparring partner of the Board of Mayor and Alderman and the top management. I believe we can grow as a team, give room to young talent and leave a distinct signature by our professional way of working. I am passionate about combining people’s talents and qualities in such a way, so we can achieve our mutual goals. I always think in possibilities and together we can find creative solutions for even the most complicated issues.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Manager Flexpool (IBA)

profile_positions.description:
As a programme manager I run a variety of different and complex projects and programmes simultaneously.
In addition to those commissioned by the council of Almere, I manage projects commissioned by  governmental organisations, different provinces and the various ministries.
A recent example of  inter-departmental and multi- agency  working was my lead on a major project around the Short Stirling project, as described in more detail  below.  

Currently, I am the programme manager for Culture, Tourism and Sport for Almere, in the Amsterdam Metropolitan Area.  I have significant experience in setting up international subsidy applications and making pitches/presentations across a variety of European Networks.

I also run and administer an Expert Centre for programme and project management. This Expert Centre focuses on helping participants improve skills and qualities around managing complex projects and programmes. We also exchange knowledge and experience with other organisations in order to share good practice and expertise. This means I regularly engage with a variety of different networks throughout the country and hold presentations. 
The Expert Centre has been built on 4 pillars:
- Advice and coaching/mentorship
- Instruments (i.e manuals and templates)
- Hiring capacity (intake and match making)
- Learning Lane
profile_positions.title: Programme manager Flexpool

profile_positions.description:
A few years ago a crashed Short Stirling, British WW2 bomber, was discovered in the Markermeer Lake and onboard were the remains of its seven crew members.
In 2020 I managed a large and complex multi-agency operation to recover this aircraft and subsequently in October 2021, I played a major role organising the formal commemoration ceremony for the downed crew, in the presence of their family members.
I managed the attendance and security arrangements for numerous VIP’s and dignitaries and managed and coordinated flying family members in to attend the ceremony from all over the world.  
It was a complex project involving numerous governmental organisations and authorities as well as a number of international organisations which was compounded by international complications around COVID19.
This required a continuous process of connecting and informing people at the right time and at the same time ensuring that all the  administrational/political coordination ran smoothly, efficiently and effectively.
In 2019 I was presented with the ‘Council Pen of Almere Award’, which is granted for best composed and written Council proposal for that year. Having had the opportunity of direct contact with the family members of the lost crew has been exceptionally meaningful to me and has been  an incredible experience.
profile_positions.title: Project manager Recovery Short Stirling BK716

profile_positions.description:
I have developed a leadership programme ‘Via Craftsmanship To Being a Master’. This programme is based on our philosophy of being a learning organisation. Through action learning , management can and do learn from each other, based on their daily work experience in the working environment.
I have described how this process is effective and my own approach of co-creating in a chapter in the book ‘The Secrets of the 10E’s’ of the Academy Builders.
This leadership programme led to us winning the NSCU Award for best practice of corporate universities, which had nationwide publicity and exposure. As a result of this, I have gone on to advise a variety of municipalities on how to successfully implement similar leadership programmes.
profile_positions.title: Programme manager leadership development

profile_positions.description: I am responsible for managing the Almere Academy, the learning and development team, where I advise in the management and developed training and learning environments. My main focus has been learning and development in order to benefit organisational change. I have organised a number of types of leadership meetings and set up numerous different kinds of learning communities. Many of these learning concepts have since been adopted  by other municipalities.
profile_positions.title: Teamleader Almere Academy

profile_positions.description: One of my responsibilities is the coordination of the Planning & Control cycles for the Almere municipality. I edit and quality assure the documents for financial statements and budgeting. I was the right hand of the compliance officer for governmental (integrity) regulations for the board of aldermen and mayor.
profile_positions.title: Advisor Policy & Strategy

profile_positions.description: I lead my team to take care of all activities in the field of planning & control, financial administration, quality management, secretary, administrative organisation and internal control for the Real Estate department.
profile_positions.title: Teamleader Projectmanagement and Staff activities

profile_positions.description: I manage all of the  planning & control activities for our building department.
profile_positions.title: Planning & control employee

profile_positions.description: I arrange insurance policies for car fleets to (potential) clients and ensure that all shareholder reporting is multilingual, in both Dutch and English.
profile_positions.title: Insurance representative

profile_positions.description: I am responsible for treasury analysis and am responsible for the cash management. The head of Treasury is situated in Dublin/Ireland and my financial responsibilities require me to work very closely with them. All shareholder reporting is in Dutch and English.
profile_positions.title: Financial Analyst
